Reviews.Title: Best Windows Phone as of early 2013
Reviews.Author: rpv
Reviews.Content: Windows 8 apps are a welcome change from iOS. Among the three ecosystems, I prefer Android, Windows 8, and iOS in that order. Blackberry, what ?! For ease of use, Windows phone is really easy to use. For someone interested in a first smartphone, Lumia 920 is an excellent choice. I got access to few Windows 8 phones to review. I will try to review them, but since I have not used for a period longer than a month I am not reviewing for reliability. User interface in Windows 8 is very pleasing and this is one of best phones with awesome user experience. If you prefer great user experience over infinite hackability, aka Android, then Windows 8 phones are great choice.The Lumia 920 has a stunning 4.5" IPS LCD, 1280x768 resolution, 332 ppi display. This phone has up to 32 GB storage and 1 GB RAM.  8.7 MP camera and a 1080p HD Video.  1.5 GHz dual core processor. I have extensively used in the past HTC Titan I and II which is pre Windows 8 (7.5) and I was surprised it has become more buttery smooth now. This phone has Gorilla Glass 2. Glass 3 is in the making and supposed to be even better. Stating following because this is highly underrated in reviews. From Corning's Gorilla Glass specs; WHAT MAKES GORILLA GLASS SO DAMAGE RESISTANT? The unique composition of Gorilla Glass allows for a deep layer of high compressive stress (created through an ion-exchange process). This compression acts as a sort of "armor," making the glass exceptionally tough and damage resistant. Ion exchange is a chemical strengthening process where large ions are "stuffed" into the glass surface, creating a state of compression. Gorilla Glass is specially designed to maximize this behavior.Lumia 920 does not support microSD expansion. I always feel this is a bummer. But with 32GB it is plenty with current app ecosystem.  These phones seem to be copying iPhone philosophy.  Battery 2000 mAh Lithium polymer battery (Compared to a high end Android Galaxy Note II, which has a battery of 3100 mAh Battery.) Unlike the Nokia Lumia 820, the Lumia 920 doesn't have a removable battery cover, which means you can't access or replace your battery. __Not having a storage expansion slot is a bummer for lot of people! Not being able to remove battery is a double bummer.__  For me, storage expansion and removal of battery is very important, so I was disappointed. This is the downside the unibody design.  Wireless charging is a big plus, though!Phone quality was excellent and speakerphone was awesome. Nice to see built in active noise cancellation with a dedicated mic. Nice to see Lumia 920 has Bluetooth 4.0. Bluetooth low energy (BLE), known as WiBree, is a subset of Bluetooth v4.0 with an entirely new protocol stack. As an alternative to the Bluetooth standard protocols that were introduced in Bluetooth v1.0 to v3.0, it is aimed at very low power applications running off a coin cell. I was able to get excellent reception with Bluetooth headset, Jaybird Sportsband Stereo Bluetooth Headphone - Bulk Packaging - Midnight Black and JayBird BlueBuds X Sport Bluetooth Headphones - Midnight Black  All the usual smartphone stuff, facebook, twitter, music, emails etc are all excellent. It is only the third party apps that are lacking in some arenas. If you are Microsoft heavy like Office suites, Lumia phone are awesome!Apps are limited in Windows 8 marketplace. Yes, we have heard this a gazillion times. Lumia has GPS receiver with A-GPS and GLONASS support. I tried with Garmin Navigon app which turned out to be great in giving voice directions. App ecosystem is a chicken and egg situation. Unless more phones are sold, developers don't have incentives to write apps. Apps are less now, because people are not buying in big droves. Windows Phone is now (early-mid 2013) the third-leading mobile phone platform, more than tripling its market share year-over-year. One recent report I read Android and iOS are ahead in games with 162.1 and 37.4 million shipments in 1Q13 and Windows phone came in 7 million. This is more than double from previous year. I really hope for Windows 8 platform to surge ahead because having a 3 way competition with iOS and Android is good for the ecosystem.ONE LINE SUMMARY: The Nokia Lumia 920 is certainly the best Windows Phone 8 smartphone on the market right now.

Reviews.Title: Though Unlocked, Certain Features Could Not Be Enabled
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This phone came from Canada. Though the phone was unlocked as advertised, a key feature called "internet sharing" or sometime "connection sharing" or "tethering" would NOT work in the USA. Tedious and hard to find internet research undertaken subsequent to purchase confirms that this feature will NOT work unless a phone is first sold and provisioned in the USA. Apparently security code requirements in the installed Windows8 software cannot be installed on phones provisioned outside of the USA. Without this security code no computer can "see" the phone or connect to it. If the "internet sharing" feature is important, it is senseless to try to by a phone that was not initially provisioned in the USA, since despite being "unlocked", it will not have the required Microsoft code loaded to provide "internet sharing". ... On the bright side, the phone was easy to return and refund was timely arranged.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff!
Reviews.Author: David Camejo "Chuckynator"
Reviews.Content: So I have never had a phone that was not a Nokia. And I am 33 years young so I've owned a few of them by now. I bought this one for my old man (who is also a Nokia guy like I am), but of course I had to play with it before giving it to my dad. I own a Lumia 900 and I was intrigued by how different from my 900 this 920 could be. It turns out it has many more settings possibilities than I was expecting it to have. On my opinion, it is even more user friendly than the Lumia 900 and much more informative for sure (i.e. the distribution of the memory usage, pics, apps, email, etc). Another big change with respect to my Lumia 900 lies on the camera of course, not to mention it has a much broader app market so you can find many more cool apps for the camera. All of this with the same "unbreakability" (if you will) that every single Nokia product is known for, and without sacrificing on materials as its design is simply astonishing. I still have not seen the first Nokia smartphone with a broken screen despite being considerably large in dimension. Ask me how many broken iPhones I have seen...

Reviews.Title: Not so bad phone, a little shady seller.
Reviews.Author: danabeyin
Reviews.Content: The box it came with was obviously old and it is NOT an unlocked phone. It came with AT&T; branding with Internet Tethering LOCKED! I use H20, which uses AT&T; so didn't have a problem with the GSM.It randomly froze more than 3 times and sometimes gets unresponsive and windows 8 has a long way to mature like iOS, and in some ways even Android.EDIT : TRYING TO FACTORY RESET THE PHONE AND IT GOT STUCK ON THE MECHANICAL GEARS SCREEN FOR MORE THAN HALF AN HOUR AND THEN GOT STUCK IN THE BLANK NOKIA SCREEN.Don't know if I could successfully reset it, but I already scheduled a pick up so I have to send it anyways.Thanks for making me change all my passwords and possibly sharing my phone data with the seller Nokia!If I could, I would give it a 1 STAR, because this is a HUGE PROBLEM.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Vendor
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: I've only had the item for a few weeks but I love it. First, Nokia is a fantastic alternative to Samsung, and the IPhones. Second, don't count Windows 8 out yet. It a good OS and the updates later in 2013 should make it even better! Finally, the recent purchase of the Nokia cell phone division by Microsoft means that Windows phones are here to stay. Do the research. Buy this phone unlocked, from the vendor that I used and save money.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Jem H
Reviews.Content: I bought this factory unlocked phone to use with a straight talk plan. The phone arrived promptly and in brand new condition. Upon arrival, the phone origins was set in Polish and the phone charger is for European outlets. I had to use Google translate to help change to English and I had my micro-usb charger from my old phoneto charge this phone, since I live in the US.  I'm very satisfied with my purchase.  FYI, I did have to do a factory reset due to some issues with straight talk and the phone remained unlocked.

Reviews.Title: Unlocked? Not really.
Reviews.Author: Jko
Reviews.Content: I have never had a phone that wasn't a Nokia.However, this particular one, or at least the seller, is terrible. It IS unlocked, but not from the factory. Mine was unlocked by AT&T; and as a result, I cannot send or receive multimedia text messages like pictures or even group text messages.I took it to an authorized T-Mobile store and they couldn't help me. They told me the phone already has some hardwired settings that only cater to AT&T; and cannot be changed.

Reviews.Title: Very underestimated
Reviews.Author: Sahid Kamara
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas and I am very satisfied with it.  If you want a good smartphone that's not very too expensive and has features of popular smartphones, go for this.  You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Everything as expected.
Reviews.Author: Vibhor B.
Reviews.Content: Phone was unlocked. Currently being used in India. Everything turned out to be as expected. Don worry about the AT&T; symbol on the phone.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: frekan
Reviews.Content: I had a Iphone and dumped it for this. It's the best thing I have ever done.Easiest phone to use.

Reviews.Title: Scratches on Back
Reviews.Author: M. A. Foster
Reviews.Content: All items arrived Before the Phone which was delivered on June 4. It was a great dissapointment to see marks on the back of the expected new Phone and the phone seem to freeze at times.

Reviews.Title: This Seller is Bogus
Reviews.Author: Monique Millar
Reviews.Content: I ordered a factory unlocked lumia 920. Im not sure what I got but it came in a dirty old box and no headphones. I previously ordered this phone from PVCS so I know it comes with headphones - that one was stolen after I received it. Anyway I thought it would be safer to replace it through an amazon fulfilled provider - not so. Don't use this seller. The product I got from PVCS was brand new and obviously factory unlocked....I'm not even sure this product is new. How do I send it back?????Not only did it come in a dirty old box, the phone did not work!! I called the seller. The sales person called me on the cellphone and confirmed that the phone did not work...I couldn't hear him and he couldn't hear me. I spoke to amazon.com and they were not exactly helpful. Anyway, I am putting the phone in the hands of UPS tomorrow morning. I want my money back and I shall be using the seller I have used previously.

Reviews.Title: Worth for the money
Reviews.Author: Vimal Raj Selvam
Reviews.Content: I've bought this phone on 24 May 2013 and decided to migrate from my iPhone. I was very excited and the phone didn't spoil my expectation when I open and use it.The weight of the phone is relatively heavier than the other latest smartphones. Despite its weight, the phone feels better to hold than any smartphones.The side buttons are easier to use and packed in a single side.The sound quality of the speakers are better than the iPhone.I really like the position of the rear camera. I never get my fingers during capturing the photos. The quality of the camera is too good. The application has the ability to change some settings, but the default settings is more than enough for normal use.The phone is more responsive than other smartphones. My friend who owns a Samsung Galaxy S3 used to tell me about crashing and not responding. But once I got my phone, I've loaded too many apps and games, and tried switching between applications. But never had problem of crashing. The loading speed of apps / games are far better than other smartphones.The touch sensitivity is better than iPhone. The display colors are brilliant, bright and vivid.All the pre-loaded Nokia apps are much better than other apps. Especially the Nokia Here Drive and Nokia City Lens. The offline maps are too useful which usually all other OS's apps lagging on it.I accept that Windows Store does not have more apps when compared to other market places. But I expect all the major app developers are making apps compatible with Windows Mobile OS.Skydrive is one of the best cloud sync application. It has lot many features than the iCloud. But still there is a major problem on Syncing your contacts / calendar from Outlook directly which you should do it through your hotmail / live / outlook account.The OneNote application is relatively simple to use it and have more ability than the Notes application in iPhone.So overall the Nokia Lumia 920 is an excellent mobile device that I've ever used so far. I agree there are some glitches, but still those are minor to me.

Reviews.Title: Love my phone
Reviews.Author: steiny1330
Reviews.Content: Great phone, love the windows os. Never had good service with an android phone. I have straight talk thru Walmart, so it is cheaper than most and works great.

Reviews.Title: Nokia Lumia 920
Reviews.Author: Brandon G.
Reviews.Content: I have got a chance to actually see if it works in my country. When I have established that I will let you know. The came properly packaged and it appeared to be a new phone.

Reviews.Title: What a phone
Reviews.Author: John F
Reviews.Content: If you are a windows user you'll love this phone. I use primarily for business and does everything I need to do in the palm of my hand. Faster than my samsung.

Reviews.Title: turned out to never work
Reviews.Author: musicjunky4life
Reviews.Content: I love how the phone connects to my laptop through Hotmail. It's easy to post my status online and connect to my friends! It's just like having a mini computer in my pocket. Battery doesn't last as long as I'd like though... I pop it on the charger once in morning and again at night. My Android I can leave off the charger over night some times.

Reviews.Title: Great Windows 8 phone
Reviews.Author: ajs
Reviews.Content: Anyone looking to get off the ANDROID BUS will certainly like the Nokia 920. The CAMERA is FANTASTIC,  I don't personally like having a NON REMOVAVLE battery but can live with it.  A+

Reviews.Title: Don't want an Andriod phone or an iPhone? GET THIS PHONE!!!
Reviews.Author: Klaus Schierholt
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review three months after I got this phone. Nokia already came out with three or four new phones since I got this one. Nonetheless, I love this phone. I wanted something different besides an Android or iPhone, but not foreign from the standpoint of functionality. Had a few updates since I got it. The quality of photos and videos I have taken with this phone are amazing. They look just as good if not better than my sister's iPhone 5S. The number of Nokia photo editing apps help too. Call quality is great. Keyboard functionality is awesome. Music sound quality is great (wish it had more room for music though, maybe an SD card slot would have been good). Even though it is heavy, this phone is solid. This phone has been good to me so far. I plan on having this phone for a while.

Reviews.Title: The phone Works Good.
Reviews.Author: Alberto
Reviews.Content: The phone works very good... but It comes without batery charger, and without bill... so I need now buy another charger or something like that, I feel cheated :(

Reviews.Title: more less
Reviews.Author: Lucio
Reviews.Content: Short duration battery and high temperaturei like my phone but the battery is badly.  in next my purch. look.sometimes i thinhk that smartphone is not newfor this i purched a new battery to change it

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: hp
Reviews.Content: The camera is awesome, good color, good effect. The only thing I'm not satisfied is the battery, it just don't work as well as the classic Nokia phoness.

Reviews.Title: The phone is ok, but...
Reviews.Author: David Hornsby
Reviews.Content: Windows Phone issues:  I don't like that you can't control the volume on any of the apps.  The app store is severely limited compared to iTunes and Android.Lumia 920 issues: I don't like where the power button is.  The battery life is rather poor.  I charge it every night and still have had it die on my twice in less than a month.Pluses: It takes great pictures.  The screen is very sharp and it is easy to watch videos on.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: M. Hidalgo
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my brother, he had saved his money to get it. It is on T-Mobile works good only problem he is yet to be able to send or receive pictures with it. We are working on fixing that for him, I am sure it has to do with APN settings. It is a Rogers Lumia so all the bands are the same as T-Mobile. He also received the the GDR2 update already. Will update if there's any changes.

Reviews.Title: For Windows fans, the worth get this phone.
Reviews.Author: Emerson Ancelmo
Reviews.Content: Camera, no comments (the best), Nokia Maps with offline navigation, really really useful and it works very well. I think it's the most social phone in the market because you can keep updated in your facebook, twitter, linkedin and etc...profile, so easy.

Reviews.Title: Good phone. Great seller.
Reviews.Author: Yixin Chen
Reviews.Content: The phone is satisfying. I like the camera very much. And I like how the phone looks. As for the rest, I'm still exploring. The seller is also very good. The original charger did not work, so the seller sent me a new one for free.

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: davinsson nunjar
Reviews.Content: Photos are amazing and apps are just what I need to have fun and be productive. Lumia runs flawlessly without issues.

Reviews.Title: Love the Lumia 920
Reviews.Author: Rishi Shripat
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Seamless design and great at multi tasking. Quick and fast response to touch and apps open quickly and run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Yang Li
Reviews.Content: Have using it for a week, everything's fine. All requirements are met. Big had heavy, suitable for boys. Like it.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone
Reviews.Author: julio moreno
Reviews.Content: I cant said anithing bad about the phone, but the box looks really dirty and that wasnt nice and thats why i give them 4 stars instead of 5

Reviews.Title: Great Phone !
Reviews.Author: Gail fleury
Reviews.Content: I had a Iphone for years... But i gotta admit Lumia is by far more complete than the iphone ! Learn how to use, and its amazing !

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected I like win 8 and the Lumina 920!
Reviews.Author: EXPAT07
Reviews.Content: Works good --- I like it better than my wife's Samsung Galaxy S the phone and Windows both are nicer to use

Reviews.Title: This is the windows phone!
Reviews.Author: Brett F.
Reviews.Content: Very, very, great phone. Built like a tank, I feel if I were to drop it at any moment, it would act like nothing happened (Almost as if it sneezed). The quality of the phone is also above and beyond. It is very smooth in your hands and comfortable to hold. Now for the actual OS, I am still getting used to it, but here are the pros and cons of such OS.Pros:+Very silky smooth interface, no lag+Easy to navigate to one place to the next+Adding tiles to the screen is easily done as well as re-arranging them+Camera is crystal clear, you will notice the quality in the shot+Included Nokia apps do wonders. (i.e. Nokia Maps you can download a location and navigate from one place to the next without having to use your dataplan)+Quality apps are starting to emerge.Cons:-Exiting out of an app requires spamming the back button in it until it has fully quit (Unlock android you can hold the home button and a task manager will pop up, allowing you to quit out of any app), in windows, you can hold down the back button to display all the open programs, but you are not able to quit out of it from there, you can only go into the app and spam the back button. (The side benefit of this is that you can redo your steps on how you navigated to the app, but I am more of a guy who likes to remove a task rather than rework all the steps I took to get to said app.-No great "Windows Phone" games titles, besides the ones already from android and iOS such as Angry Birds, Plants vs Zombies, etc.-NO MEDIA PLAYER CONTROLS NATIVE TO THE DEVICE. What I mean by that is, you can play a song from the music player, but if you are in another app or want it to play in the background, the ONLY way to get up some interface on how to control the song (Stopping, Pause, Play, Skip, Previous) is by going to your lockscreen, which can be a simple as tapping your power button on and off really quick. But android is very fluid in that you have something built in and it is easily accessible, AND GOD FORBID YOU DON'T TOUCH THE CONTROLS, it will then auto hide itself. Also, there is an app on the windows phone that somebody made for $0.99 cents/dollar that will basically stop the music for you and clear it from your data.... I mean, really microsoft? Please fix that, lol. -_-That is my review, I hope it will be helpful to anybody looking to purchase said device, I mainly got it from developing but am using the device for my own phone purposes because of the quality it actually has, just the additional fixes would make this the phone to be for others I feel.-1 star mainly for the media player controls only being on the lockscreen or inside the media player itself, no native controls to it while the music is playing in the background (Also a simple stop button and clear would be nice as I said in the cons where a person made an app that does such and sells it for $0.99, which is pretty sad).

Reviews.Title: review of Nokia 920 international phone
Reviews.Author: Robert Waters
Reviews.Content: NO!  It was not a phone for the US.  It will only work up 3 G and not 4 G as with ATT. and others. It was misrepresented.I will be most careful buying anything else from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone !!!
Reviews.Author: Q®om
Reviews.Content: Leaving the BlackBerry World and trying other else. I decided about this phone because long time ago that i had a Windows Phone and was the better pone, practical, fast for use applications (With all the iisues) and this time is not the exception (Now very few issues on this new pone). This phone is extremely Practical, you reach any on just few taps, everything is on Hand. I know that is not the phone with more applications but is the last phone to enter in scene. Aditional to this the Nokia 920 add some features and things that make it  much better pone. The carbonate Material, the Camera is really nice & take very good pictures and video (The best on any pone), search, dowloads applications is very easy, call any pc or people with skype is really cheap and useful, the Nokia HERE Pack is really nice and amazing. Like i said in my wireless charger review you dont know what missing until try this...in Resume, its a great pone, Stable (all pones have some issues, but in general is very stable), Fast, Practical 100% (all in Hand), easy & very nice to configure Screen and all the things. I am so Happy with the change , i think that this product will be on top in few time, just need  to be know. If you can ... buy with eye blind : )

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: D. Varma "DV"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my son and he is loving it.  He was given choice between android, iphone and this one and he chose this

Reviews.Title: Good Phone
Reviews.Author: Javier Kolberg
Reviews.Content: Microsoft and Nokia, still need to be faster with the release of new apps, there are a lot of apps you don't found. Otherwise it's a great phone, fast, and solid. The only horrible thing is that you can't go back to the previus page with Internet Explorer (or at least i can't find how to). I hope in a few month Nokia and Microsoft will release more apps.

Reviews.Title: Does not function on AT&T;'s 4G LTE network
Reviews.Author: J. Barry Ryan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this specifically because at the time it was stated that it works on LTE networks.  Maybe true but not in the USA on AT&T.;  It worked fine but only on the much slower 3G network.  There was an APN defined on the phone for ATT LTE but it did not put me on their LTE network.  The phone and features are superb just not very useful to me with the slow speed network.  I returned it and will be careful with the specs on my replacement.

Reviews.Title: Phone does not work properly
Reviews.Author: Reynaldo Gazzo S "Ragazzo"
Reviews.Content: I was sent an unlocked phone by At&T; which does not allow me to share internet the function does not work, I contacted the supplier but up to this moment there is no solution to my problem, as you can imagine I purchased a full working phone not a limited one, therefore I am not happy with this and still waiting for a solution. This is the second time I buy this phone the first time with a different supplier it worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: memory in 920 is less than 1020 the newer version.
Reviews.Author: Louis, Mina
Reviews.Content: 1 GB ram is small comparing to 1020 which is 2 GB ram...the camera is great. the battery is not that much of great 2 days at most.

Reviews.Title: GREAT SELLER, BEST PHONE EVER
Reviews.Author: Olisaebuka Maduka "O. Maduka"
Reviews.Content: The Seller,I bought mine from 'On the Go Solutions' and I'll heavily recommend them to other customers. They deliver on time, respond to questions, and the phone I received was brand new and in good condition (atleast for this brief time I've used it). And yes, it's RM-821 International factory unlocked!!!The Phone,It's phonetastic, camtastic, fastastic (a speedy little monster this one), strongta.... well you get were I'm going with this. The phone is Amazing, my sisters played with it briefly and now won't let me use it; one was asking how come she has never heard of the Lumia or windows phone before, seeing how great and fluid this phone is. Infact this fluidity is what has quite captivated them, that and the gorgeous user interface & hardware design.This phone was announced on the 5th of September last year (my birthday) and today fate has finally caught up with it because it was always meant to be mine.SUMMARY: A truly wonderful phone.

Reviews.Title: great response from the seller
Reviews.Author: Abelardo Estrada
Reviews.Content: the phone in fact, needs a few updates by microsoft, I hope in the near future things get better, there are a few things I miss from nokia e7, like the maps feature of point and drive me there, profile settings, timed profiles, etc.

Reviews.Title: Great apps, great camera, heavy duty
Reviews.Author: Mario A. Di Casir
Reviews.Content: Made out of very durable materials, has a fluid touch screen, great camera and lens, and decent battery life. It's a little too big, but you get used to it.

ProductInfo.Name: Nokia Lumia 920 Unlocked GSM Phone - Black
